name: overmatched
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
smaller in number or less strong, good, etc. than someone or something: Overmatched, police called in the California Highway Patrol in a desperate bid for control. There's nothing like an enthusiastic crowd to galvanize a seemingly overmatched team.
More examplesFewer examplesShe seemed a bit overmatched for the job.There were glimpses of his breathtaking talent on the pitch, but he often looked overmatched. He doesn't feel like he's overmatched at this level.
